bestBHT.bht: On the same day, when the evening came, Jesus said to his disciples, and they sailed across the Sea of Tiberias in a small boat. The placement of this journey in the narrative highlights its significance, connecting it with the teachings and parables of Jesus. The storm that agitated the lake was not accidental; it was a test of faith. Jesus dismissed the multitude, desiring to strengthen his disciples' relationship with him.

Henry Alford: This journey across the lake, with its incidents, is placed by St. Mark and St. Luke after the series of parables commencing with that of the sower.
The same day, when the even was come, he saith unto them.
The placement of this journey in the narrative highlights its significance and serves to connect it with the teachings and parables of Jesus.
Albert Barnes: This was on the Sea of Tiberias.
The 'ship' in which they sailed was probably a small open boat with sails.
There were many other ships in company with him.
John Calvin: Those who infer, from the diversity of the names, that the narratives are different, through a desire to be thought very acute, fall under the charge of gross ignorance."
The storm which agitated the lake was not accidental: for how would God have permitted his Son to be driven about at random by the violence of the waves?"
Let us learn hence that, whenever any adverse occurrence takes place, the Lord tries our faith.
Philip Schaff: The best authorities omit the definite article.
It was, however, the boat from which he had been teaching.
His disciples, probably the Twelve, though others followed in other boats.
John Gill: The multitude were dismissed... being desirous also of trying the faith of his disciples."
Christ took this method... they should be alone with him."
In order to be clear of them, Christ took this method.

bhtAttempts.bht: On the same day, when the evening came, Jesus said to his disciples, and they sailed across the Sea of Tiberias in a small boat. The placement of this journey in the narrative highlights its significance, connecting it with the teachings and parables of Jesus. It was not a random storm that agitated the lake, for God would not allow his Son to be driven about aimlessly. In fact, the storm served as a test of the disciples' faith. Jesus dismissed the multitude and chose to be alone with his disciples, taking this opportunity to further strengthen their relationship with him.
